g1_male_momayez_item2: It is recommended not to cut the hair of the head and beard for one month before entering Ihram.
g1_general_item1: It is disliked (makruh) to use henna before Ihram in such a way that its effect remains during Ihram
g1_female_item1: She may use medication to delay her monthly period, with a doctor’s consultation.
g2_male_item1: Two white, unstitched pieces of cloth (izar and rida)
g2_female_item1: Plain, non-adorned regular clothing for ihram
g2_general_item1: Soap, toothpaste, and shampoo without fragrance
g3_general_item1: If a person does not practice taqlid, they should, before traveling, choose a marjaʿ (religious authority) according to the principles stated in jurisprudential books.
g3_general_item2: It is necessary to learn the correct recitation of prayer and talbiyah before the journey.
g3_general_item3: Learn the practical rulings of wudu (ablution), ghusl (ritual bath), and prayer.
g3_general_item4: Learn the rulings regarding the purity of clothing and the body.
g3_general_item5: Learn the rulings of Umrah according to the fatwas of one’s marjaʿ.
g3_female_item1: Learn the rulings related to the monthly (menstrual) cycle.
outside_mighat: I am outside the Miqat (for example, coming from Pakistan)
mecca_resident: I am a resident of Mecca.
jeddah_resident: I am a resident of Jeddah
mecca_mighat: My home is located between Mecca and the miqāt
boundary_mighat: Along the boundary between two miqats
mighat_guide_item1: The miqāt for the people of Madinah and those coming by that route is Dhul-Hulayfah (Masjid al-Shajarah).
mighat_guide_item2: The miqāt for the people of Syria, Egypt, the Maghreb, and those coming by that route is Juhfah.
mighat_guide_item3: The miqāt for the people of Ta’if and those coming by that route is Qarn al-Manāzil (al-Sayl al-Kabīr).
mighat_guide_item4: The miqāt for the people of Yemen and those coming by that route is Yalamlam.
mighat_guide_item5: The miqāt for the people of Iraq and Najd and those passing by that route is Dhāt ‘Irq.
mecca_mighat_text:
Your miqāt is Adnā al-Ḥill (the nearest point outside the Sacred Precinct), such as Hudaybiyyah, Ji‘rānah, and Tan‘īm (Masjid ‘Ā’ishah).
These three places do not have any special distinction; rather, entering into ihrām from any location outside the boundaries of the Haram of Mecca is sufficient.
jeddah_mighat_text: For him, it is permissible to enter into the state of ihram  from Jeddah itself, without there being any need to make a vow, and it is also not obligatory for him to go to any of the miqats.
between_mecca_mighat_text: For you, it is permissible to go to Jeddah without entering into ihram, and it is not obligatory to go to the miqat in order to enter into ihram.
before_mighat_title: Only in two cases may you enter into ihram before the miqat:
vow_warning_text:
Attention before making a vow:
If you know that after entering into ihram by vow, your journey to the Sacred Precinct (Haram) will coincide with rain, then in that case the vow is not fulfilled (based on obligatory precaution).
solution_item1: Arrange your travel in such a way that this problem does not arise.
solution_item2: Refer to the next most learned religious authority and act according to his ruling.
fomo_text: If you are concerned that by waiting until reaching the miqat you will not be able to enter into ihram during the month of Rajab, then in that case you may enter into ihram in the month of Rajab, before the miqat and without making a vow, from any location.
nadhr_description: The vow formula must be recited verbally and can be done in two ways
nadhr_method_item1:
Without specifying a particular place for entering Ihram
According to this formula, before the Miqat or parallel to the Miqat, you may enter Ihram at any place you wish.
nadhr_method_item2:
By specifying a particular place for entering Ihram
The specified place must be before the Miqat or parallel to the Miqat.
with_place_box_text: لِلّٰهِ عَلَیَّ أَنْ أُحْرِمَ قَبْلَ الْمِیقَات
without_place_box_text: لِلّٰهِ عَلَیَّ أَنْ أُحْرِمَ مِنْ --- (مثلاً: لاہور)
nadr_notice_text:
By making a vow, a person does not become maḥram.
Wait until you reach the place where, according to the vow, you must enter the state of iḥrām, and from there enter iḥrām.
